item.title: Maria add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Maria add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Maria add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Maria add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Maria add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Maria add a quote by John Greenleaf Whittier
item.description: "Of all sad words of tongue or pen, the saddest are these, 'It might have been." -- John Greenleaf Whittier

item.title: Maria add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Maria add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end. Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next. Delicious Ambiguity." -- Gilda Radner

item.title: Maria add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; itâ€™s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Maria add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Maria add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If cats looked like frogs we'd realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That's what people remember." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Maria add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Maria add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Maria add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Maria add a quote by George Harrison
item.description: "If you don't know where you're going, any road'll take you there" -- George Harrison

item.title: Maria add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Maria add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Maria add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Maria add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Maria add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "In real life, I assure you, there is no such thing as algebra. " -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Maria add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "My favorite animal is steak." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Maria add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "There is no such thing as inner peace. There is only nervousness and death." -- Fran Lebowitz
